result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Torstenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber. Standard release conditions.
Court grants 5 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. ALL COSTS AND DNA PAID IN FULL.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Only $500.00 applied to costs. Refund remaining bail to poster.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular.   Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael E Torstenson in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court report immediatly after court.   Cash bail as previously posted.

Defendant Michael E Torstenson in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
